title.narrative: Accessible inclusive and modular emergency school

description.narrative: In the project FCA and Combi Works together define make specifications and pilot one school building a design which is particularly suitable for Nepal and generally in any area of crisis and may be the product for space rental business.The project includes :- Visual spatial and functional specification and the adaptation of the building model in the Nepalese context as well as risk analyzes as part of pre-feasibility study- Hiring local business partners and partners' identification- Evaluation and review of Nepal as part of the commercial objectives of the business plan- Technical design together with:- The building and the technical implementation of the components within local context- The visual and physical implementation of the design; including interio r and furniture as well as accessibility and education - Planning and logistics - The manufacture and testing of components of the building - Production of the parts of the building the acquisition of systems and transport to the target site at UCEP's voca tional school campus and installation as part of the piloting solutions- Training local partners- The definition surveys and testing a continuation of the business plan and the piloting mode Rental business model- The use of the school building and trainin g systems in accordance with the type of building and sustainable development the dissemination of new teaching methods through teacher training courses as well as inclusiveness and accessibility to spread not only within the vocational school also for oth er schools organizations and governmental bodies as well as other vocational school use-The presentation of the business model for other local and international organizations public authorities and businesses.- Environmental and social impact study through out the project and finally as part of the evaluation carried out a survey to all stakeholders.
